channel.title: Minecraft - ubuntu help
channel.description:
ok i can get minecraft to run fine. the only problem is i have to execute the launcher from a usb drive. why? i should be able to execute it from my desktop... i run minecraft_name that works fine. when i click ok. the launcher doesnt load but there is a process still running... why is this happening? is it some new feature ubuntu added with 10.10? ik they add this one thing that doesnt allow u to execute programs that havent be marked safe by ubuntu.
summed up i can rune minecraft just fine i just have to go out of my way to do so. any help would be appreciated. thx.

item.title: Minecraft - ubuntu help
item.dc:creator: @noobs_are_ftw noobs are ftw
item.description:
@noobs_are_ftw wrote:

Runs on kubuntu for me

Read full topic

item.title: Minecraft - ubuntu help
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

[quote=“Nueb35, post:10, topic:380071”]java -cp ~/.minecraft/bin/*;~/.minecraft/ -Djava.library.path=~/.minecraft/bin/natives/ net.minecraft.client.Minecraft[/quote] that didnt work.

Moparisthebest:

There you go. That class needs to be in your class path.

this is confusing. i dont understand, i use the exact same file in the exact same way, just in different location. the local one says the class isnt in my classpath but the external file has no problem and runs fine. would i declare the classpath as a jvm argument?

Read full topic

item.title: Minecraft - ubuntu help
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

There you go. That class needs to be in your class path.

item.title: Minecraft - ubuntu help
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

this is the error i get:


Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: net.minecraft.LauncherFrame
	at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:202)
	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
	at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:190)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:307)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:248)
	at Loader.load(Loader.java:27)
	at Loader.main(Loader.java:21)

Try it from the command line, that way you can read the error.

item.title: Minecraft - ubuntu help
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

i just click and run minecraft_name.jar with java. the problem is the transition from minecraft_name to minecraft.jar(launcher). running minecraft.jar directly works fine.

Read full topic

item.title: Minecraft - ubuntu help
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

How are you ‘running’ it? Did you try opening up the command line and typing:

java -jar /path/to/your/minecraft/launcher.jar

?

Read full topic

item.title: Minecraft - ubuntu help
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

well i can only get it to run from an external location. i downloaded grahams menu launcher and it loads like that but i wont be able to play the official server since i cant change my name. im going to look at grahams code and see how that working and make a custom thing for me. btw i have this same problem with all 3 computers i installed xubuntu 10.10 on.

Read full topic

item.title: Minecraft - ubuntu help
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

It glitches like this for me sometimes, I usually end all processes and load it up again. It works fine for me to. I usually open up my task manager and close Java and javaw and try it then.

Read full topic
